audio_1.mp3.line: This is the true story of a 17-year-old who made a split-second decision that saved his fellow Marines.

audio_3.mp3.line: Iwo Jima's black volcanic ash coated everything.

audio_4.mp3.line: Private First Class Jacklyn Lucas advanced with three Marines.

audio_5.mp3.line: They moved cautiously through a narrow trench.

audio_7.mp3.line: Two grenades landed at their feet.

audio_8.mp3.line: Lucas shouted a warning to his squad.

audio_10.mp3.line: Lucas threw himself forward onto one grenade.

audio_11.mp3.line: He pulled the second grenade beneath his body.

audio_12.mp3.line: The explosions tore through his chest and right side.

audio_13.mp3.line: His fellow Marines survived without a scratch.

audio_15.mp3.line: President Truman presented him the Medal of Honor.

audio_16.mp3.line: The youngest Marine ever to receive our nation's highest decoration.

audio_17.mp3.line: One moment of extraordinary courage saved three lives.

audio_18.mp3.line: Remember the heroes who sacrificed everything for their brothers in arms.
